meanings.definition: A person or thing that removes or puts a head on something.
meanings.sent1: The header carefully placed the cap on the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The chef is the header who adds the final touch to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The playful header pretended to be a king by wearing a crown.
meanings.sent4: She was the header of the family, always making sure everyone was taken care of.
meanings.sent5: The header in charge of the assembly made sure everyone was seated properly.

meanings.definition: A line of text at the top of a page or section of a document.
meanings.sent1: The header of the report included the title and date.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the header of your essay contains your name and class.
meanings.sent3: The header of the letter was so big it took up half the page.
meanings.sent4: The header of the webpage was bold and eye-catching.
meanings.sent5: The header of the email was concise and informative.

meanings.definition: A brick or stone laid at right angles to the face of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully placed each header in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The header in the brick wall added strength and stability.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child used the header as a makeshift toy block.
meanings.sent4: The header in the wall stood out with its unique color.
meanings.sent5: The header in the structure was the key to its durability.
